task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 69°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To estimate the building height accurately I need to see the roofline and ground contact, so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.
The heading reset to 0° so I’m no longer facing the target building; I should rotate right to ~69° while staying pitched up to capture the roofline.
I need to see the full vertical extent (roof and base) of the building, so I should look up while keeping the building centered at 69°.
The view is again at heading 0° rather than the target 69°, so I should rotate right to re-align to 69° while keeping the upward pitch.
To estimate height I need the roofline in view, so I should tilt up at the same heading and then provide an estimate.
Since the heading keeps resetting to 0° after pitching up, I should rotate to the target building direction (~69°E) and then stop with the height estimate once it’s centered.
I’m already aligned to the building at 69° so I should now provide the best height estimate from the current full-building view rather than keep oscillating.
